definition: to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: Notes on some species of Araliaceae from Guizhou.
sentences.chinese: 贵州五加科某些种类的考订。

sentences.english: What were we to do with our material ? First, the task of criticism.
sentences.chinese: 我们该怎样处理这些材料呢？首先是进行考订。

sentences.english: Hence, studying common words is also my article' s important task.
sentences.chinese: 所以，考订俗字，也是本文的重要内容。

sentences.english: This is very important in furthur recognizing Chen and Wu's poems, which is the first time of systematically combing and collating their corresponding poems.
sentences.chinese: 此文首次对这些交往诗进行了较为系统的爬梳与考订。

definition: to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
